[HEADING] MEngr, Systems Engineering
[HEADING] Related Programs
[HEADING] Explore Grad Aggieland
[HEADING] 2024-2025 GPSG President Tamra Walderon: A Legacy of Resilience, Leadership and Advocacy
[HEADING] Fifty Shades of May
[HEADING] NutriClay strategies against foodborne AMR bacterial pathogens
College of Engineering, Interdepartmetal Degree Programs
Texas A&M University - College Station
As the clock ticks down on my time in Aggieland and I write this, my final blog after writing for five years, I hope that May surprises me.
[GRID_TABLE]
MEngr, Systems Engineering
College of Engineering, Interdepartmetal Degree Programs
Texas A&M University - College Station




Apply Now 
Visit Program Website 







Program Quick Facts








A student holding a Bachelor of Science degree in engineering or a qualified senior during the last semester may apply for admission to graduate studies to work toward the non-thesis degree of Master of Engineering (MENG), majoring in his or her particular field of engineering.

The work in the major field will include one or two written reports (not necessarily involving results of research conducted by the candidate).

The Masters of Engineering in Systems Engineering provides students with the latest cross-disciplinary concepts, tools and skills in systems engineering. These skills are essential for the design, integration, operation, and maintenance of large-scale engineered systems in the government, military and civil industries.

The systems engineering discipline is focused on the successful realization of engineered systems. The scope of systems engineering spans the entire system life cycle, from earliest conception through system retirement.

The Masters of Engineering in Systems Engineering program will prepare students for careers in all aspects of systems engineering while allowing them to tailor their academic program for depth in a particular industry or skill type.





Related Programs

Industrial Engineering
MS
College Station

View Details

[HEADING] Degree
Highlights
[HEADING] Questions? Email isengradadmissions@tamu.edu.
Degree Overview
More Information
Please see the Texas A&M industrial and systems engineering course catalog for course descriptions. Note that the prefix for ALL industrial and systems engineering courses is ISEN.
Required Courses (18 hours total)
Electives Courses
The ISEN Department has 4 areas of research: Advanced Manufacturing, Operations Research, Human and Health Systems and Data Science. Students learn best practices in research.
To calculate cost, select Graduate, select the semester you’ll start, select Residency, choose “Engineering” from the drop-down menu,  select Program and slide “Hours” to how many you’ll take each semester. Your total cost is Tuition and Required Fees.
Discover answers to frequently asked questions tailored to assist you in making informed decisions regarding your education with Texas A&M Engineering.
Howdy! Thank you for your interest in the industrial and systems engineering graduate program. Learn about our degrees and which one best suits you and your goals.
• Degree Overview

30 credit hours
1.5 years to complete
No tracks or specialization
All-encompassing degree

pages.content:
[HEADING] Graduate Programs & Degrees
[HEADING] Howdy!
[HEADING] Texas A&M is a leading global destination for graduate and professional education. We are committed to delivering transformative graduate education that prepares future leaders and innovators in academia, government, and industry. Our core values—integrity, excellence, and selfless service—guide every aspect of our mission to provide student-centered holistic support, unparalleled resources, and rich experiences to help students reach their full potential.
[HEADING] We offer over 290 doctoral, master’s, professional, and certificate programs, taught by more than 4,000 world-class faculty. Explore our directory below to find the program that’s right for you. Contact us with any questions about how Texas A&M fits into your academic, professional and personal goals.
[HEADING] Category
[HEADING] Explore Grad Aggieland
[HEADING] 2024-2025 GPSG President Tamra Walderon: A Legacy of Resilience, Leadership and Advocacy
[HEADING] Fifty Shades of May
[HEADING] NutriClay strategies against foodborne AMR bacterial pathogens
As the clock ticks down on my time in Aggieland and I write this, my final blog after writing for five years, I hope that May surprises me.
[GRID_TABLE]

Howdy! Texas A&M is a leading global destination for graduate and professional education. We are committed to delivering transformative graduate education that prepares future leaders and innovators in academia, government, and industry. Our core values—integrity, excellence, and selfless service—guide every aspect of our mission to provide student-centered holistic support, unparalleled resources, and rich experiences to help students reach their full potential. We offer over 290 doctoral, master’s, professional, and certificate programs, taught by more than 4,000 world-class faculty. Explore our directory below to find the program that’s right for you. Contact us with any questions about how Texas A&M fits into your academic, professional and personal goals.
